Consider $S^3\subset {\mathbb{R}}^4={\mathbb{C}}^2$. The structure of
${\mathbb{C}}^2$ gives a map ${\mathbb{C}}^2-\{0\}\to{\mathbb{C}}P^1$,
the complex projective line by the natural projection. Since
${\mathbb{C}}P^1$ is homeomorphic to $S^2$, by restriction to $S^3$, we
get a map $\pi:S^3\to S^2$. We call this the Hopf bundle.

This is a , and a generator of $\pi_3(S^2)$. From the :
$$\cdots\pi_n(S^1)\to \pi_n(S^3)\to\pi_n(S^2)\to\cdots$$ we get that
$\pi_n(S^3)\cong \pi_n(S^2)$ for all $n\geq 3$. In particular,
$\pi_3(S^2)\cong\pi_3(S^3)\cong{\mathbb{Z}}$.
